items.summary: Tuhk highlighted as a Canadian fintech startup to watch in 2026, building a collaborative payments platform that enables secure, real-time data sharing between merchants, banks, and service providers to combat global fraud. Direct competitor positioning around data rails.

InPublishing covered Revaly's partnership with AdvantageCS, noting the integration pairs AdvantageCS's billing capabilities with Revaly's specialized payment recovery intelligence to recover a greater share of failed digital payments while reducing involuntary churn.

Paddle is bringing cancellation flows directly into the Paddle Billing dashboard in early 2026, signaling continued investment in their Retain product. Claims 25-30% reduction in customer churn through smart card retries and automated retention offers.

Kount leverages decades of global data from 20,000+ brands in 250 geographical locations. Platform offers sub-100ms real-time scoring for payments and uses ML/AI that learns from new fraud techniques. Competitive benchmark for AI-powered detection.

Chargebacks911 reports that 32.4% of merchants use 3-D Secure, 17.8% use RDR (Rapid Dispute Resolution), and 26.3% use pre-chargeback alerts to prevent chargebacks. Low adoption rates suggest opportunity for better solutions.
Chargeflow raised $35M Series A funding and won G2's 2026 Best Software Awards for best commerce software products. Strong momentum for AI-powered chargeback automation competitor.

Payment service providers now standardizing agentic AI for automatic route selection and retries to maximize approval rates. Systems automatically selecting routes and retries to maximize approval rates while controlling cost.
Kount is currently transitioning to Equifax, which may bring additional data resources for fraud prevention capabilities. Noted in Signifyd alternative comparison.

CatalystPay recommends intelligent retry logic that staggers attempts over days rather than hammering the same card repeatedly for VAMP compliance. Proactive communication when payments fail with grace periods before access restrictions.
Chargebacks911 warns merchants to prepare for surge in post-holiday disputes as Lunar New Year spending accelerates across Asia-Pacific and international eCommerce markets.
New promotional video for Revaly created by Burnwe, describing it as 'a payment performance management platform.' Professional marketing push with video content.

AdvantageCS, a major subscription billing platform, announced partnership with Revaly to enhance digital payment recovery. Integration provides intelligent retry guidance for failed transactions to reduce involuntary churn.
Global chargebacks volume projected to increase by 41% between 2023 and 2026, from 238 million to 337 million disputes. Creates significant market opportunity for payment recovery solutions.

Visa excessive chargeback threshold will drop from 2.2% to 1.5% for merchants in North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific starting March 2026. Tighter regulatory environment increases pressure on payment recovery.

Kount (acquired by Equifax 2021) claims 99% fraud decisions delivered in under 400ms, potential to reduce chargeback rates by 72% and false declines by 46%. Strong competitive benchmark for AI-powered fraud prevention.
Industry reports AI-powered smart retries can automatically recover up to 41% of failed payments without coding. Setting market expectations for recovery performance.
Chargebacks911 reports serving over 18,000 companies and notes 72% of merchants experienced increased friendly fraud chargebacks in 2024. Demonstrates scale of chargeback management market.
